Smart Alarm Clock with Voice Control: Equip the alarm clock with voice control capabilities, allowing users to set alarms, snooze, or turn off the alarm with just their voice. This feature can be particularly useful for those who prefer not to touch the clock or want to keep their hands clean.

Alarm Clock with Sleep Tracking: Incorporate a sleep tracking feature that monitors the user's sleep patterns and provides recommendations for improving their sleep quality. This can include tips on creating a sleep-conducive environment, setting consistent sleep times, and avoiding caffeine before bedtime.

Multi-Alarm Clock with Multiple Alarms: Design an alarm clock with multiple alarms, allowing users to set different alarms for various purposes (e.g., one for work, one for a meeting, and one for a personal reminder). This can help users manage their time more effectively and reduce the number of alarms they need to set.

Solar-Powered Alarm Clock: Create an eco-friendly alarm clock that runs on solar power, reducing the user's carbon footprint and saving on electricity costs. The clock can also feature a low-power mode to conserve energy when the sun isn't shining.

Alarm Clock with Built-in White Noise: Incorporate a built-in white noise feature into the alarm clock, allowing users to choose from various sounds (e.g., rain, ocean waves, or forest sounds) to help them fall asleep or wake up more gently.
